page.title: 07EVENTS
page.content: FOOTBALL ON THE MUD was first played between Marchwood Flounders and Hythe Eels in 1905 on the mudfflats to the north od Hythe Pier, where competitors endured 15 minutes each way of wallowing up to waist deep in the mud. By selling programmes at 1d. each they raised much needed funds for Hythe Hospital. In 1983 the Hythe & District Rotaract Club were made custodians of the Mudlarks Challenge Cup. Up until the early 1970's the match was contested by teams from the local Fire Services at its present site behind the Post Office, and after a few years of inactivity, the custom was resurrected in 1978 by the Rotaract Club. HYTHE PRIMARY SCHOOL CENTENARY - everybody had to dress up in old-fashioned clothes. Dress ranged through Victorian, Charleston, punk to modern dress. This was in 1983.
